sen.j: 玉木 吉保（たまき よしやす、天文 (元号)21年7月8日（1552年）- 寛永10年（1633年））は、戦国時代 (日本)の安芸国の戦国武将。
sen.e: Yoshiyasu TAMAKI (July 8, 1552 - 1633) was the Sengoku Busho of Aki Province during the Sengoku period.
Yoshiyasu TAMAKI (August 8, 1552 - 1633) was the busho (Japanese military commander) of Aki Province during in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).
sen.cmt: ・グレゴリオ暦にしました。 ・Bushoの説明を追加しました。・「戦国時代」の訳を用語集に従い書き換えました。
sen.e: Yoshiyasu TAMAKI (August 8, 1552 - 1633) was the busho (Japanese military commander) of Aki Province during in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).

sen.j: 毛利氏家臣。
sen.e: A retainer of the MORI clan.
He was a retainer of Mori clan.
He was a retainer of Mori clan.

sen.j: 医師としても著名である。
sen.e: He was also a well-known doctor.
He was also a well-known doctor.
He was also a well-known doctor.

sen.j: 父は玉木忠吉。
sen.e: His father was Tadayoshi TAMAKI.
His father was Tadayoshi TAMAKI.
His father was Tadayoshi TAMAKI.

sen.j: 通称は初次丸、又三郎、太郎左衛門尉。
sen.e: His common name was Shojimaru, Matasaburo, and Tarozaemon no jo.
His common name was Shojimaru, Matasaburo, and Tarozaemon-no-jo.
sen.cmt: 「初次丸」の読み方は不明です。・Tarozaemon no joにハイフンを足しました。
sen.e: His common name was Shojimaru, Matasaburo, and Tarozaemon-no-jo.

sen.j: 医師名は偽真。
sen.e: His name used as a doctor was Gishin
His name used as a doctor was Gishin
His name used as a doctor was Gishin

sen.j: 官位は土佐守。
sen.e: His official court rank was Tosa no kami.
His official court rank was Tosa no kami (a governor of Tosa Province).
sen.cmt: 「土佐守」の説明を加えました。
sen.e: His official court rank was Tosa no kami (a governor of Tosa Province).

sen.j: 1552年に玉木忠吉の子として生まれた。
sen.e: He was born a child of Tadayoshi TAMAKI in 1552.
He was born as the child of Tadayoshi TAMAKI in 1552.
sen.cmt: bornの後にasを補い、aをtheに変えました。
sen.e: He was born as the child of Tadayoshi TAMAKI in 1552.

sen.j: 1564年、13歳の時に真言宗勝楽寺に入り修行する。
sen.e: In 1564, when he was 13, he joined the Shoraku-ji Temple of the Shingon sect and trained there.
In 1564, when he was 13, he joined Shoraku-ji Temple of Shingon sect and trained there.
In 1564, when he was 13, he joined Shoraku-ji Temple of Shingon sect and trained there.

sen.j: 下山後に毛利氏の家臣としての主要な行動を開始し、1569年に旧領の周防国山口市に侵入した大内輝弘追討に参加している。
sen.e: After leaving the temple, he begun working as a retainer for the MORI clan carrying out important tasks; furthermore, he joined a troop to hunt down Teruhiro OUCHI who had invaded Yamaguchi City in Suo Province, a former territory, in 1569.

After leaving the temple, he began to carry out important tasks as a retainer for the Mori clan; for example, he joined a troop to hunt down and kill Teruhiro OUCHI who had invaded Yamaguchi City in Suo Province, a former territory of the Mori clan, in 1569.
sen.cmt: ・"begun"を"began"と訂正しました（スペルミス）・前半の文を組み換えました。・Furthermoreをfor exampleにしました。・"hunt down"だけだと「追い詰める」という意味になるようなので、「討つ」という意味が入るように"kill"を追加しました。
sen.e: After leaving the temple, he began to carry out important tasks as a retainer for the Mori clan; for example, he joined a troop to hunt down and kill Teruhiro OUCHI who had invaded Yamaguchi City in Suo Province, a former territory of the Mori clan, in 1569.

sen.j: その後天正年間には尼子氏の尼子勝久、山中幸盛らに追討に参加し、1578年の上月城の戦いにも加わっている。
sen.e: Later, during the Tensho period, he joined a troop to hunt down people such as Katsuhisa AMAGO of the AMAGO clan and Yukimori YAMANAKA and also joined the Battle of the Kozuki-jo Castle in 1578.
Later, during the Tensho period, he joined a troop to hunt down and kill Katsuhisa AMAGO and Yukimori YAMANAKA, and he also joined the Battle of the Kozuki-jo Castle in 1578.
sen.cmt: hunt downのうしろに"and kill"を追加しました。"such as"と"of the AMAGO clan"を削除しました。
sen.e: Later, during the Tensho period, he joined a troop to hunt down and kill Katsuhisa AMAGO and Yukimori YAMANAKA, and he also joined the Battle of the Kozuki-jo Castle in 1578.

sen.j: 1580年6月、毛利輝元と織田信長の対立が激しくなる中、上方に赴いて曲直瀬道三流の医術を修行する。
sen.e: He trained himself in the Dosan MANASE-lined medicine after traveling to the Kyoto region in June, 1580 when the confrontation between Terumoto MORI and Nobunaga ODA was intensifying.
He went to Kyoto and learned medicine according to the method of Dosan MANASE in June 1580 when the confrontation between Terumoto MORI and Nobunaga ODA was intensifying.
sen.cmt: 前半部分を書き換えました。
sen.e: He went to Kyoto and learned medicine according to the method of Dosan MANASE in June 1580 when the confrontation between Terumoto MORI and Nobunaga ODA was intensifying.

sen.j: 修得後に帰国し、1585年の豊臣秀吉による四国征伐に参加。
sen.e: After mastering medicine, he joined the Shikoku conquest by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in 1585.
After mastering medicine, he joined the troops to go on an expedition to Shikoku led by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in 1585.
sen.cmt: 「四国征伐」の部分を書き換えました。
sen.e: After mastering medicine, he joined the troops to go on an expedition to Shikoku led by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in 1585.

sen.j: 1587年頃より毛利氏の領国支配の強化のため、安芸国、備後国、周防国、長門国、石見国、出雲国、伊予国等の検地を実施している。
sen.e: He conducted surveys of land including Aki, Bingo, Suo, Nagato, Iwami, Izumo, and Iyo Provinces in order to enforce control of the territories owned by the MORI clan around 1587.
He conducted land survey of Aki, Bingo, Suo, Nagato, Iwami, Izumo, and Iyo Provinces in order for Mori clan to strengthen the control of to these provinces around 1587.
sen.cmt: 文の流れがより自然になるよう、少し文を変えました。
sen.e: He conducted land survey of Aki, Bingo, Suo, Nagato, Iwami, Izumo, and Iyo Provinces in order for Mori clan to strengthen the control of to these provinces around 1587.

sen.j: 1592年から始まる文禄の役にも毛利氏家臣として出征し、朝鮮半島の地で代官職である「郡外邦」に任ぜられた。
sen.e: He went to the front as a retainer of the MORI clan in the Bunroku no Eki which started in 1592 and was appointed the post of local governor, 'Gungaiho', in the Korean Peninsula.

He went to Korea to join the Imjin war breaking out in 1592 as a retainer of Mori clan, and then he was appointed the post of Gungaiho (a chief magistrate in a foreign country) in the Korean Peninsula.
sen.cmt: 「文禄（慶長）の役」は"Imjin war"が定訳のようです。郡外邦とは海外での地方官をさすようなので説明を付け加えました。
sen.e: He went to Korea to join the Imjin war breaking out in 1592 as a retainer of Mori clan, and then he was appointed the post of Gungaiho (a chief magistrate in a foreign country) in the Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 1593年に朝鮮の地から引き上げ、豊臣秀吉による伏見城築城に参加している。
sen.e: He returned from Korea in 1593 and joined the construction project of the Fushimi-jo Castle led by Hideyoshi Toyotomi.
He returned from Korea in 1593 and joined the construction project of the Fushimi-jo Castle led by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
He returned from Korea in 1593 and joined the construction project of the Fushimi-jo Castle led by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 1600年の関ヶ原の戦いの時の行動は不詳であるが、敗戦後は毛利氏に従い周防・長門国に移住した。
sen.e: His involvement in the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600 is unknown; however, he followed the MORI clan and moved to Suo and the Nagato Provinces after losing the battle.
His involvement in the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600 is unknown; however, he followed the Mori clan and moved to Suo and Nagato Provinces after the Mori clan lost the battle.
sen.cmt: より内容が明確になるよう、言葉を足しました。
sen.e: His involvement in the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600 is unknown; however, he followed the Mori clan and moved to Suo and Nagato Provinces after the Mori clan lost the battle.

sen.j: そして50歳を過ぎ、老境に入ったことから自身の健康のためにも医術に専念するようになる。
sen.e: Moreover, he further concentrated on the medicine to maintain his health since he was getting old, being over 50 years old himself.
Then, he concentrated on learning medicine to maintain his health since he was over 50.
sen.cmt: MoreoverをThenに変えました。・「老境に入った」という原文の訳を、わかりやすくするためあえて削りました。
sen.e: Then, he concentrated on learning medicine to maintain his health since he was over 50.

sen.j: 1633年、82歳の長寿で没した。
sen.e: He lived to be 82.
He lived to be 82.
He lived to be 82.

tit.j: 医師としての玉木吉保と「身自鏡」
tit.e: Yoshiyasu TAMAKI as a medical doctor and "Minokagami" (Biography of Yoshiyasu TAMAKI)
Doctor Yoshiyasu TAMAKI and His Book "Minokagami" (Biography of Yoshiyasu TAMAKI)
tit.cmt: タイトルっぽくなるように訳しました。
tit.e: Doctor Yoshiyasu TAMAKI and His Book "Minokagami" (Biography of Yoshiyasu TAMAKI)

sen.j: 玉木吉保の名は戦国武将としてよりも医師として知られている。
sen.e: Yoshiyasu TAMAKI is know as a medical doctor, rather than being the Busho, during the Sengoku Period.
Yoshiyasu TAMAKI is rather known as a doctor than as a busho.
Yoshiyasu TAMAKI is rather known as a doctor than as a busho.

sen.j: 多くの医術書を記し、その効用は現代でも通用する現代的なものである。
sen.e: He wrote much medical literature and techniques described in the literatures were current enough so that they are applicable even in our time.
He wrote many medical books, and techniques described in the books modern enough to apply now.
He wrote many medical books, and techniques described in the books modern enough to apply now.

Books

"Kamyakusho" (Treatment book which described methods for measuring a pulse)

sen.j: 戦国乱世が終焉を迎えた1617年に玉木吉保は「身自鏡」を記した。

Yoshiyasu TAMAKI wrote "Minokagami" in 1617 when the Period of Warring State was over.

sen.j: これは毛利元就から毛利輝元、毛利秀就の3代に仕え、数多くの戦に参加した吉保の自叙伝である。
sen.e: This book related to himself who served 3 generatiions of MORI lords, Motonari, MORI, Terumoto MORI, and Hidenari MORI, and participated in many battles.

sen.e: This book is the autobiography of himself who served three generations of the Mori family, Motonari MORI, Terumoto MORI, and Hidenari MORI, and who participated in many battles.

sen.j: 戦国武将の生活を知ることのできる貴重な資料となっている。
sen.e: This book became an important reference to understand the lives of the Busho in the Sengoku Period.

sen.j: 吉保は執筆や医術以外にも連歌や料理にも通じており、非常に教養の高い人物であったことがうかがえる。
sen.e: It is predicted that Yoshiyasu was a highly educated person who knew well about not only writings and medicine but also Renga and cooking.
This book shows that Yoshiyasu was a highly educated person who was familiar not only with writings and medicine but also with Renga and cooking.
